1.card_text: Play: Ready and fight with a friendly creature.
1.flavor_text: “Don’t make them angry you say? Heh. The Brobnar are born angry.” –Old Bruno

2.card_text: Play: Put each artifact on top of its owner’s deck.

3.card_text: Play: Place 2<A> from the common supply on an enemy creature.

4.card_text: Play: Choose a house. For the remainder of the turn, each friendly creature of that house may fight.

5.card_text: Play: If your opponent has 7<A> or more, they lose 4<A>.
5.flavor_text: “If you can’t protect it, you don’t deserve it.” –Bilgum Avalanche

6.card_text: Play: Destroy each enemy creature except the most powerful enemy creature. Destroy each friendly creature except the most powerful friendly creature. Ready and fight with your remaining creature.

7.card_text: Play: Destroy each undamaged creature. Gain 3 chains.

8.card_text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, each friendly creature may fight.

9.card_text: Play: Deal 4<D> to a creature with 2<D> splash.

10.card_text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, gain 1<A> each time an enemy creature is destroyed.
10.flavor_text: “Loot the Bodies! Hit the Floor! Loot the Bodies! Hit the Floor!” –Brobnar War Chant

11.card_text: Play: Steal 2<A> if your opponent has 3 or more Logos cards in play.
11.flavor_text: “Them bots don’t wear pants. I carry spares.”

13.card_text: Play: Ready and fight with up to 3 different friendly creatures, one at a time.

14.card_text: Play: Gain 2<A> if you control more creatures than your opponent.

15.card_text: Play: Discard cards from the top of your deck until you either discard a Brobnar creature or run out of cards. If you discarded a Brobnar creature this way, put it into your hand.

16.card_text: Play: Stun a creature and each of its neighbors.

17.card_text: Play: For each creature you have in excess of your opponent, a friendly creature captures 1<A>. Each creature cannot capture more than 1<A> this way.

18.card_text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, gain 1<A> each time a friendly creature fights.

19.card_text: Deal 1<D> to each creature after it enters play.

22.card_text: Action: Ready and fight with a friendly creature.
22.flavor_text: “I said ‘take me to your leader’ and got a fist to the face.”  –Captain Val Jericho

23.card_text: Your opponent’s keys cost +1<A> for each friendly damaged Brobnar creature.

24.card_text: Omni: Sacrifice Mighty Javelin. Deal 4<D> to a creature.

25.card_text: Each time an enemy creature is destroyed during your turn, a friendly creature captures 1<A>.

26.card_text: Omni: Sacrifice Screechbomb. Your opponent loses 2<A>.
26.flavor_text: “I think that thing made me deaf!”“What? I can’t hear you! I think that thing made me deaf!”

27.card_text: Action: Gain 1<A> for each enemy creature that was destroyed in a fight this turn.
27.flavor_text: It doesn’t matter what the treasure is, only how it was won.

28.card_text: After you forge a key, deal 2<D> to each enemy creature.
28.flavor_text: “Some call her ‘warleader.’ Some call her ‘demon.’ I just call her ‘Avalanche.’” –Dodger

29.card_text: Valdr deals +2<D> while attacking an enemy creature on the flank.

30.flavor_text: Whatever he doesn’t like, he breaks. He doesn’t like anything.

31.card_text: Play: Destroy each creature with power 3 or lower.

32.card_text: Before Fight: Deal 1<D> to each enemy creature.
32.flavor_text: Guess how he got that name.

33.card_text: Play: You may ready and fight with a neighboring creature.
33.flavor_text: It takes two to fight, but more is better.

35.flavor_text: “I mean, I think it’s a head...”

36.card_text: Play: Deal 2<D> to each other undamaged creature.

37.card_text: Kelifi Dragon cannot be played unless you have 7<A> or more.Fight/Reap: Gain 1<A>. Deal 5<D> to a creature.

38.card_text: Each enemy Brobnar creature gets –2 power.
38.flavor_text: Overthrowing this king is an uphill battle.

39.card_text: After an enemy creature is destroyed fighting Krump, its controller loses 1<A>.

40.card_text: Play: If your opponent has 7<A> or more, they lose 2<A>.
40.flavor_text: “I thought his name would turn out to be... metaphorical.” – Quixo the “Adventurer”

41.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Reap: For the remainder of the turn, gain 1<A> each time an enemy creature is destroyed.

42.card_text: After an enemy creature is destroyed fighting Mugwump, fully heal Mugwump and give it a +1 power counter.

43.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Deal 1<D> to each enemy creature after it enters play.

44.card_text: During your turn, each time you discard a Brobnar card from your hand, you may deal 4<D> to a creature.

45.card_text: At the end of your turn, if you played exactly one card this turn, Rogue Ogre heals 2 damage and captures 1<A>.
45.flavor_text: “I like to think of it as a Roguere.” –Dodger

46.flavor_text: “I’m not sure he knows any other words.”

47.card_text: Tireless Crocag cannot reap.You may use Tireless Crocag as if it belonged to the active house.If your opponent has no creatures in play, destroy Tireless Crocag.

48.flavor_text: Don’t feed it, it’ll go away.

49.card_text: Play: Return each other friendly Brobnar creature to your hand.

50.flavor_text: “Blood of Giants? Why stop there?”  –Pingle Who Annoys

51.card_text: This creature gains, “Destroyed: Return this creature to its owner’s hand and deal 3<D> to each creature in play.”

52.card_text: This creature gains taunt.Play: Fully heal this creature.

53.card_text: Play: Discard the top card of your opponent’s deck and reveal their hand. You gain 1<A> for each card of the discarded card’s house revealed this way. Your opponent repeats the preceding effect on you.

54.card_text: Play: Choose a house. Return each creature of that house from your discard pile to your hand. Gain 1 chain.

55.card_text: Play: Choose a house on your opponent’s identity card. Your opponent must choose that house as their active house on their next turn.

56.card_text: Play: Purge up to 2 cards from a discard pile.
56.flavor_text: “As far as oblivions go, it’s in my bottom three.” –Dr. Escotera

57.card_text: Play: Choose a number. Destroy each creature with power equal to that number.

58.card_text: Play: Return an enemy creature to its owner’s hand.

59.card_text: Play: Destroy each creature. Gain 3 chains.

60.card_text: Play: Deal 3<D> to a creature. If it is not destroyed, its owner discards a random card from their hand.
60.flavor_text: “Just trying to understand these...’things’ gives me a headache.”

61.card_text: Play: Destroy each creature with any <A> on it.
61.flavor_text: C’mon, take it. You know you want to.

62.card_text: Play: Destroy a creature that is not on a flank.

63.card_text: Play: Destroy each Dis creature. Each player gains 1<A> for each creature they controlled that was destroyed this way.

64.card_text: Play: Deal 1<D> to each creature. Deal an additional 3<D> to each creature if your opponent forged a key on their previous turn.

65.card_text: Play: Return each creature to its owner’s hand.

66.card_text: Play: If your opponent forged a key on their previous turn, unforge it. Your opponent gains 6<A>.

67.card_text: Play: Your opponent discards a random card from their hand.

68.card_text: Play: Each undamaged creature captures 1<A> from its opponent.

69.card_text: Play: Use an artifact controlled by any player as if it were yours. Destroy that artifact.

70.card_text: Play: Each enemy creature with armor loses all of its armor until the end of the turn and is dealt 1<D> for each point of armor it lost this way.

71.card_text: Play: Destroy the 3 most powerful creatures.

72.card_text: When a creature would enter a discard pile from play, it is purged instead.

73.flavor_text: “I know I shouldn’t’a nicked it, but ‘twere so…shiny. –Noddy the Thief

74.card_text: Omni: Sacrifice Key to Dis. Destroy each creature.

75.card_text: Action: Keys cost +3<A> during your opponent’s next turn.
75.flavor_text: “At first, I thought that nothing could harm an Archon.”  –Captain Val Jericho

76.flavor_text: ”This place takes the idea of losing yourself in a book to a whole new level.” – Doc Bookton

77.card_text: Omni: Sacrifice Lifeward. Your opponent cannot play creatures on their next turn.

78.card_text: Action: Purge a friendly Human creature from play. If you do, play a creature from your discard pile.

79.card_text: Action: Shuffle your hand and discard pile into your deck.
79.flavor_text: ”Was that you, or the cave?” - Captain<nonbreak>Val<nonbreak>Jericho

80.card_text: Each time a creature is destroyed, its owner gains 1<A>.
80.flavor_text: No one goes in, no one comes out. And yet the fires burn.

82.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Play: If your opponent has 7<A> or more, capture all of it.

83.flavor_text: When the demon’s away, the imps will play.

84.card_text: Fight/Reap: Purge a creature from a discard pile. If you do, put a +1 power counter on Eater of the Dead.

85.card_text: Your opponent cannot play more than 2 cards each turn.

86.card_text: Before Fight: Choose a creature. Gabos Longarms deals damage to that creature rather than the one it is fighting.

87.card_text: After an enemy creature is destroyed fighting Overlord Greking, put that creature into play under your control.

88.card_text: Play/Fight/Reap: Heal up to 2 damage from a creature. Deal that amount of damage to another creature.

89.card_text: Reap: You may destroy a creature with 1 power.

90.card_text: Reap: You may destroy a creature with 2 power.

91.card_text: Reap: You may destroy a creature with 3 power.

92.flavor_text: “They come from another world, they are pure evil made flesh and steel, and they lurk in the darkest corners of the land. Yes, I’m comfortable calling them ‘demons.’” –Science Officer Wu

93.card_text: Taunt. (This creature’s neighbors cannot be attacked unless they have taunt.)While Pitlord is in play you must choose Dis as your active house.

94.card_text: Play: Choose a house. Your opponent cannot choose that house as their active house until Restringuntus leaves play.

95.card_text: At the end of your turn, your opponent loses 1<A>.
95.flavor_text: “Do you want imps? This is how you get imps.”

96.card_text: Play: If your opponent has 4<A> or more, steal 1<A>.
96.flavor_text: “Demons only take, never give.” - The Sanctified Scroll

97.card_text: Fight/Reap: Return an artifact or flank creature to its owner’s hand.
97.flavor_text: It’s only sensible to fear the dark.

98.card_text: After an enemy creature is destroyed fighting Stealer of Souls, purge that creature and gain 1<A>.

99.card_text: During their “draw cards” step, your opponent refills their hand to 1 less card.

100.card_text: Your opponent must pay you 1<A> in order to use an artifact.

101.card_text: Play: If your opponent has no <A>, gain 2<A>.
101.flavor_text: “I once thought that these creatures could be redeemed. Now I know better.” –Champion Anaphiel

102.card_text: Reap: Your opponent discards a random card from their hand.

103.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Each time a creature is destroyed, its opponent gains 1<A>.

104.card_text: You must lose 3<A> in order to play Truebaru.  Taunt. (This creature’s neighbors cannot be attacked unless they have taunt.)Destroyed: Gain 5<A>.

106.card_text: This creature gets +2 power and gains hazardous 2. (Before this creature is attacked, deal 2<D> to the attacking enemy.)

107.card_text: Play: Destroy an enemy creature and a friendly creature. You may repeat this effect as many times as you like, as long as it is possible to repeat the entire effect.

108.card_text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, any <A> you would gain from reaping is stolen from your opponent instead.

109.card_text: Play: Each player loses half their <A> (rounding down the loss). Gain 1 chain.

110.card_text: Play: Your opponent cannot use creatures to fight on their next turn.

111.card_text: Play: Search your deck and discard pile for a Timetraveller, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your discard pile into your deck.

112.card_text: Play: If an opponent forges a key on their next turn, they must give you their remaining <A>.

113.card_text: Play: Choose one: Archive a card, or, for each archived card you have, gain 1<A>.

114.flavor_text: Attention to detail is the key to all progress.

115.card_text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, each time you play another card, draw a card.

116.card_text: Play: If your opponent has more <A> than you, steal 1<A> and draw a card.

117.card_text: Play: You may play one non-Logos card this turn.

118.card_text: Play: Deal 3<D> to a flank creature. Deal 2<D> to its neighbor. Deal 1<D> to the second creature’s other neighbor.

119.card_text: Play: Archive the top card of your deck.

120.card_text: Play: Use an opponent's artifact as if it were yours.

121.card_text: Play: Swap your deck and your discard pile. Then, shuffle your deck.

122.card_text: Play: Your opponent cannot play action cards on their next turn.

123.card_text: Play: Archive a card. Discard a card.
123.flavor_text: Don’t fret the details. Progress happens when you least expect it.

124.card_text: Play: Deal 2<D> to a creature and deal 2<D> to a different creature.

125.card_text: Play: Play the top card of your deck.
125.flavor_text: “But if we ever do recover the dataprobe, think of what we will learn!”

127.card_text: Action: Choose a house. Reveal the top card of your deck. If it is of that house, play it.

128.card_text: Action: Discard the top card of each player’s deck. For each of those cards, destroy a creature or artifact of that card’s house, if able. If 2 cards are not destroyed as a result of this, destroy Crazy Killing Machine.

129.flavor_text: When you make an archive of all knowledge in the galaxy, don’t be surprised when you understand almost none of it.

130.card_text: Action: Archive Mobius Scroll and up to 2 cards from your hand.
130.flavor_text: Once upon a time there was a scroll that began: Once upon a time…

131.card_text: You may spend <A> on Pocket Universe when forging keys.Action: Move 1<A> from your pool to Pocket Universe.

132.card_text: Action: Purge a creature in play. If you do, your opponent gains control of Spangler Box. If Spangler Box leaves play, return to play all cards purged by Spangler Box.

133.card_text: Action: Choose a creature. For the remainder of the turn, that creature is considered a flank creature and gains, “Reap: Draw a card.”

134.card_text: After you forge a key, destroy each creature and artifact.

135.card_text: During their “draw cards” step, each player refills their hand to 1 additional card.

136.card_text: Skirmish. (When you use this creature to fight, it is dealt no damage in return.)Fight: Steal 1<A>.
136.flavor_text: The worst part is the singing.

137.card_text: After a creature is destroyed fighting Brain Eater, draw a card.

138.card_text: Play: Capture 1<A>.Destroyed: Put Dextre on top of your deck.

139.flavor_text: “Don’t worry, Momo. We’ll have this quantum death ray installed in no time.”

140.card_text: Play: Gain 1<A> for each forged key your opponent has.
140.flavor_text: “Interesting reaction, but what does it mean?”

141.card_text: Play: Your opponent discards each of their archived cards. You gain 1<A> for each card discarded this way.

142.flavor_text: “They offered to let my crew stay with them. I politely declined.” –Captain Val Jericho

143.card_text: Play: Take control of an enemy flank creature until Harland Mindlock leaves play.

144.card_text: Skirmish. (When you use this creature to fight, it is dealt no damage in return.)Fight: Draw a card.
144.flavor_text: “...I’ll leave this part out of the memoir.”

145.card_text: During your “draw cards” step, refill your hand to 1 additional card.
145.flavor_text: “Of course she’s necessary, she’s the mother of all invention!”

146.card_text: Play/Fight/Reap: Destroy an enemy creature or artifact and a friendly creature or artifact. Discard the top card of your deck. If that card is not a Logos card, trigger this effect again.

147.card_text: Action: Archive a card from your discard pile.
147.flavor_text: “One civilization’s trash is... nope, still trash.”

148.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Fight/Reap: Heal 3 damage from a Mars creature or stun a Mars creature.

149.card_text: Play/Reap: Look at your opponent’s hand.
149.flavor_text: “I’d make more, but I discovered lesser minds aren’t worth reading.” – Biologician Moreau

150.card_text: Reap: Trigger the reap effect of another creature in play as if you controlled that creature. (That creature does not exhaust.)

151.card_text: Destroyed: Archive the top card of your deck.

152.card_text: Play: Your opponent cannot use any cards next turn. (Cards can still be played and discarded.)

153.card_text: Play: Draw 2 cards. Action: Shuffle Timetraveller into your deck.

154.card_text: While Titan Mechanic is on a flank, each key costs –1<A>.
154.flavor_text: If they come, they will build it.

155.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Reap: Choose a house. Reveal the top card of your deck. If it is of that house, archive it and gain 1<A>. Otherwise, discard it.

156.card_text: Each time you use an artifact, gain 1<A>.
156.flavor_text: Logos are divided into two camps: Theorists and Mechanists. Each believes themselves to be superior to the other.

157.card_text: This creature belongs to all houses.Play: Stun and exhaust this creature.
157.flavor_text: “This is for our research, so be honest. How do you feel?”

158.card_text: This creature gains, “Fight/Reap: If this is the first time this creature was used this turn, ready it.”

159.card_text: This creature gains, “Action: Swap this creature with another friendly creature in the battleline. You may use that other creature this turn.”

160.flavor_text: Partly cloudy with a chance of acid rain.

161.card_text: Play: Reveal any number of Mars cards from your hand. For each card revealed this way, draw 1 card.

162.card_text: Play: Choose a house. Reveal your opponent's hand. Discard each creature of that house revealed this way.

163.card_text: Play: Each Mars creature and each Robot creature is stunned. Each artifact is destroyed.

164.card_text: Play: For each friendly Mars creature, choose an enemy creature to capture 1<A> from their own side.

165.card_text: Play: If your opponent has 6<A> or more, deal 3<D> to each enemy creature.
165.flavor_text: “They poisoned Mars. We must not let them do the same here.” –Eldest Bear

166.card_text: Play: Return each Mars creature to its owner's hand. Then, you may forge a key at +9<A> current cost, reduced by 1<A> for each card in your hand.

167.card_text: Play: Choose a creature. For each damaged creature, give the chosen creature two +1 power counters.

168.card_text: Play: Reveal your hand. Purge each revealed non-Mars creature and gain 1<A> for each card purged this way.

169.card_text: Play: Put up to 3 damaged enemy creatures into your archives. If any of these creatures leave your archives, they are put into their owner’s hand instead.

170.card_text: Play: Shuffle each Mars creature into its owner’s deck. Each player gains 1<A> for each creature shuffled into their deck this way.

171.card_text: Play: For each friendly ready Mars creature, deal 2<D> to a creature. (You may choose a different creature each time.)

172.card_text: Play: Reveal any number of Mars cards from your hand. For each card revealed this way, deal 2<D> to a creature. (You may choose a different creature each time.)

173.card_text: Play: Stun each non-Mars creature. Gain 2 chains.
173.flavor_text: “Martians love da smell of dis spice, but it reminds me of Old Bruno’s feet.” - Dodger

174.card_text: Play: Steal 1<A> for each friendly ready Mars creature.

175.card_text: Play: Put an enemy creature into your archives for each key your opponent has forged. If any of these creatures leave your archives, they are put into their owner’s hand instead.

176.card_text: Play: Lose all your <A>. Then, your opponent loses triple the amount of <A> you lost this way.

177.card_text: Play: The next creature or artifact you play this turn enters play ready.
177.flavor_text: Any landing you walk away from…

178.card_text: Play: Ready a Mars creature or stun a non-Mars creature.

179.card_text: Play: For each friendly ready creature, gain 1<A>. Return each friendly creature to your hand.

180.card_text: Omni: Sacrifice Combat Pheromones. You may use up to 2 other Mars cards this turn.
180.flavor_text: “Don’t worry, this will only sting a lot.”

181.card_text: Action: Reveal any number of Mars cards from your hand. For each card revealed this way, you may ready one Mars creature.

182.card_text: Action: For the remainder of the turn, gain 1<A> each time a creature reaps.
182.flavor_text: Behold the glory of Nova Hellas!

183.card_text: Omni: Sacrifice Custom Virus. Purge a creature from your hand. Destroy each creature that shares a trait with the purged creature.

184.card_text: Action: Discard a creature from your hand. If you do, gain 1<A>.

185.card_text: Action: Discard cards from the top of your deck until you discard a Mars creature or run out of cards. If you discard a Mars creature this way, put it into your hand.

186.card_text: Omni: Reveal a Mars creature from your hand. If you do, archive it.
186.flavor_text: Most Martians on the Crucible came out of one of these tanks.

187.card_text: Action: Reveal any number of Mars cards from your hand. Deal damage to a creature equal to the number of Mars cards revealed this way.

188.card_text: Action: For the remainder of the turn, each creature loses elusive.
188.flavor_text: Even the Martians’ pets have a bone to pick with the other lifeforms on the Crucible.

189.card_text: Action: Return a ready friendly Mars creature to your hand. If you do, put a Mars creature with a different name from your hand into play, then ready it.

190.card_text: Reap: The next Mars creature you play this turn enters play ready.

191.card_text: Taunt. (This creature’s neighbors cannot be attacked unless they have taunt.)Chuff Ape enters play stunned.Fight/Reap: You may sacrifice another friendly creature. If you do, fully heal Chuff Ape.

192.card_text: Ether Spider deals no damage when fighting.Each <A> that would be added to your opponent’s pool is captured by Ether Spider instead.

193.card_text: Your opponent’s keys cost +1<A>.Fight/Reap: Capture 1<A>.

194.card_text: You cannot play creatures.  After an enemy creature is destroyed fighting Grommid, your opponent loses 1<A>.

195.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Fight/Reap: Ready a non-Agent Mars creature.

196.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Action: Choose an enemy creature. It captures 1<A> from its own side.

197.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Action: Your opponent loses 1<A> for each other friendly Mars creature.

198.card_text: Fight/Reap: Deal 3<D> to each Human creature. This damage cannot be prevented by armor.

199.card_text: After you play another Mars creature, fully heal Tunk.
199.flavor_text: “Who’s driving?” “I thought you were.”“Let’s…not tell the Elders.”

200.card_text: Fight/Reap: Use a friendly non-Mars creature.

201.card_text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Reap: Put an enemy creature into your archives. If that creature leaves your archives, it is put into its owner’s hand instead.

202.card_text: Reap: You may archive a friendly creature or artifact from play.
202.flavor_text: Nothing helps me think like wanton destruction.

203.card_text: Yxili Marauder gets +1 power for each <A> on it.Play: Capture 1<A> for each friendly ready Mars creature.

204.card_text: Fight/Reap: Deal 2<D> to a creature. If this damage destroys that creature, purge it.

205.card_text: Taunt. (This creature’s neighbors cannot be attacked unless they have taunt.)Yxilx Dominator enters play stunned.
205.flavor_text: Core power online. Stand by for domination.

206.card_text: Zorg enters play stunned. Before Fight: Stun the creature Zorg fights and each of that creature’s neighbors.

207.card_text: Fight/Reap: You may reveal a creature from your hand. If you do, archive it and Zyzzix the Many gets three +1 power counters.

208.card_text: This creature gains, “Destroyed: You may put this creature into its owner's archives.”

209.card_text: This creature gains, “After you play a Mars creature, ready this creature and for the remainder of the turn it belongs to house Mars.”

210.card_text: This creature gains, “Your opponent's keys cost +2<A>.“

214.card_text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, each creature you play gains, “Play: Deal 2<D> to an enemy creature.”

215.card_text: Play: Heal 1 damage from each creature. Gain 1<A> for each creature healed this way.

216.flavor_text: Thy body is an illusion. Only thy spirit is eternal.

217.card_text: Play: Each player with 6<A> or more is reduced to 5<A>.
217.flavor_text: The cities of the Sanctum are safe, clean, and vibrant like few others on the Crucible. But few are judged worthy to enter.

218.card_text: Play: For each creature your opponent controls in excess of you, gain 1<A>.

219.card_text: Play: Each friendly Knight creature captures 1<A>.
219.flavor_text: “As your spirit is holy, so æmber, which is the spirit of the earth, is holy.” - The Sanctified Scroll

220.card_text: Play: Ready and use a friendly creature.
220.flavor_text: “The Sanctum gives meaning to my life.” - Duma the Martyr

221.card_text: Play: Deal 3<D> to a creature and 3<D> to a neighbor of that creature.

222.card_text: Play: Destroy each of your artifacts. Gain 2<A> for each artifact destroyed this way.

223.card_text: Play: Ready and fight with a friendly creature 3 times, each time against a different enemy creature. Resolve these fights one at a time.

224.card_text: Play: Stun each enemy creature not on a flank.
224.flavor_text: “Truly I say to you: pie is superior to cake.” - from the Ravings of the Prophet Gizelhart

225.card_text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, each friendly creature cannot be dealt damage.

226.card_text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, each time a friendly creature fights, it captures 1<A>.

227.card_text: Play: Choose a friendly creature to capture 2<A>.

228.card_text: Play: Purge a creature with power 5 or higher.

229.card_text: Play: Destroy each creature with power 3 or higher.
229.flavor_text: “The spirit is eternal. The flesh is weak. Let go the flesh, for your earthly strength is the greatest prison.” - The Last Book

230.flavor_text: On the Crucible, there is no sanctimony. There is only Sanctumony.
